H0.text: Buoyancy is the term for the ability of a fluid to exert an upward force on any object placed in it.

H1.text: Viscosity is the term for the ability of a fluid to exert an upward force on any object placed in it.

H2.text: Density is the term for the ability of a fluid to exert an upward force on any object placed in it.

H3.text: Resonance is the term for the ability of a fluid to exert an upward force on any object placed in it.

A4.text: Buoyancy, or upthrust, is the force exerted by a fluid opposing the weight of a partially or fully immersed object.
